auto_detect.title: Auto-Detecting Energy Sensors
auto_detect.description:
Scanning your Home Assistant Energy Dashboard and devices...

We prefer cumulative energy sensors (kWh) because they provide the most reliable data for optimization. The backend will automatically compute power values from these.

This may take 10-15 seconds.

device_discovery.title: Discovered Energy Devices
device_discovery.description:
{device_details}

Click Next to proceed to sensor review.

review.title: Review & Select Sensors
review.description:
We recommend using the following cumulative energy sensors (kWh). Select from the dropdown or enter a custom entity ID below each sensor.

‚úÖ Cumulative sensors provide the most reliable data
üìù Custom fields override dropdown selections

data_description.solar_production: Select cumulative solar energy production sensor (kWh preferred)
data_description.battery_charge: Select cumulative battery charge energy sensor (kWh preferred)
data_description.battery_discharge: Select cumulative battery discharge energy sensor (kWh preferred)
data_description.grid_import: Select cumulative energy imported from grid (kWh preferred)
data_description.grid_export: Select cumulative energy exported to grid (kWh preferred)
data_description.house_load: Select house load sensor (optional, auto-calculated if omitted)

pricing.title: Configure Dynamic Pricing
pricing.description:
intuiHEMS uses EPEX Day-Ahead spot prices for optimization.

üí∂ Enter your additional costs on top of the spot price
üìä These values help calculate the most cost-effective battery strategy

‚ú® Historic data will be collected automatically on first run

data_description.epex_markup: Additional cost you pay on top of EPEX spot price (taxes, fees, supplier margin)
data_description.grid_export_price: Feed-in tariff you receive for exported energy
